Shareholder nay to related party transactions may jeopardise Kalyani Group firm | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Shareholder Rejection of Related Party Transactions Risks Kalyani Group's Operations

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Live Mint

The minority shareholders of Automotive Axles Ltd have rejected proposed related party transactions with Meritor HVS India Ltd due to concerns about transparency, which could disrupt the company's operations.

  • Shareholders voiced concerns over the potential erosion of shareholder value.
  • Proxy advisory firms influenced the decision against the transactions.
  • The rejection could impact the operational strategies of Automotive Axles Ltd.
"The decision was influenced by proxy advisory firms about transparency and potential erosion of shareholder value."

This decision underscores the importance of shareholder oversight and governance in corporate transactions, potentially setting a precedent for similar actions in the future.
newTitle: Shareholder Rejection of Related Party Transactions Risks Kalyani Group's Operations

Databricks raises $10B as it barrels toward an IPO - TechCrunch
summary:
Databricks raises $10B as it barrels toward an IPO

Posted: 6:41 AM PST · December 17, 2024 | Source: TechCrunch

Databricks, the data analytics platform, has raised $10 billion in a funding round that values the company at $62 billion (up from $43 billion). Backers include Thrive Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, DST Global, GIC, and Iconiq Growth.

The round is one of the largest venture rounds in history, and will drive future mergers and acquisitions, stock payouts to employees, and expansion abroad, according to a statement obtained by CNBC.

Databricks’ mammoth “Series J” comes ahead of the company’s hotly anticipated IPO. Founded in 2013 by seven doctorate candidates from UC Berkeley, Databricks sells AI, big data analytics, and cloud tooling to enable companies to build data- and AI-powered applications.

Databricks expects to generate positive free cash flow for the first time with a $3 billion revenue run rate in the quarter that ends on January 31, according to CNBC. The company’s revenue in the October quarter grew more than 60% year over year.
newTitle: Databricks raises $10B as it barrels toward an IPO

title: Stocks to Watch on December 18: Ambuja Cements, Aurobindo Pharma, JSW Energy, LTIMindtree, Aditya Birla Real E - CNBCTV18
summary:
Stocks to Watch on December 18: Ambuja Cements, Aurobindo Pharma, JSW Energy, LTIMindtree, Aditya Birla Real Estate

Date & Source: Published on December 18, 2024 by CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to watch today, including Ambuja Cements, Aurobindo Pharma, JSW Energy, LTIMindtree, and Aditya Birla Real Estate.

  • Ambuja Cements: Announced the amalgamation of its subsidiaries with the parent company and will issue new equity shares.

“Birla Estates Private Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of Aditya Birla Real Estate Limited… has acquired a land parcel covering 70.92 acres in Boisar for INR 104.3 Crore.”

In summary, these companies are making significant moves that could impact their stock performance and market perception.
newTitle: Stocks to Watch on December 18: Ambuja Cements, Aurobindo Pharma, JSW Energy, LTIMindtree, Aditya Birla Real Estate

Companies Act | Approval Of Shareholders Mandatory For Listing Shares On Stock Exchange : Supreme Court - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Approval Of Shareholders Mandatory For Listing Shares On Stock Exchange: Supreme Court

Publication Date: December 10, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has ruled that shares converted from debt to equity cannot be listed on the stock market without prior in-principle approval from the shareholders of the company, emphasizing the importance of regulatory compliance.

  • The ruling affirms the requirement stated in Section 62(1)(c) of the Companies Act, 2013.
  • The appeal was brought by Jyoti Ltd. concerning the denied listing of shares on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
  • Even with shareholder consent, shares require recognition from the stock exchange under SEBI rules before listing.
  • The court found that the appellant cannot bypass shareholder approval simply due to the debt conversion process initiated by an external company.
“No error or illegality has been committed either by the BSE or the Securities Appellate Tribunal in refusing to accept the request of the appellant company for the listing of the shares...”

This decision reinforces the necessity for transparency and accountability in corporate actions involving share allotments and listings.
newTitle: Supreme Court Ruling on Mandatory Shareholder Approval for Stock Exchange Listings

Upcoming Electric Cars To Debut At Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Upcoming Electric Cars To Debut At Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

Date: January 17, 2025   Source: GaadiWaadi

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, happening on January 17 in New Delhi, will feature a variety of electric vehicles from leading automakers. Enthusiasts can look forward to witnessing the debut of several electric cars, including models from Maruti, Hyundai, and Tata.

  • Maruti e-Vitara: Maruti’s first-ever EV for the Indian market, expected driving range of 450-500 km.
  • Hyundai Creta EV: Local production with a range of 400-500 km, will compete with existing models.
  • Tata Harrier EV: Features V2L and V2V charging capabilities and a range of 500+ km.
  • MG Cyberster: A sports convertible with a driving range of up to 580 km and expected pricing between Rs 50-60 lakh.
  • Toyota Urban Cruiser EV: Similar specs to Maruti's e-Vitara, but slightly larger, launching after its twin.
“The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 is set to be a landmark event for EV launches in India.”

The expo promises to showcase significant advancements in electric vehicles, reflecting the growing commitment of automakers to sustainable mobility.
newTitle: Upcoming Electric Cars To Debut At Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025

title: His startup is now worth $62 billion. It gave away its first product for free. | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
His startup is now worth $62 billion. It gave away its first product for free.

Publication Date: N/A Source: Live Mint

Ali Ghodsi's journey from a college student in Sweden to a tech entrepreneur has transformed his startup into a $62 billion company by initially giving away its product for free.

  • Ghodsi was inspired by the idea of improving struggling companies, comparing them to patients needing surgery.
  • The startup’s remarkable growth seems to challenge conventional wisdom about product pricing.
  • The company’s business model has drawn attention for its innovative approach to customer acquisition.
“I loved the fact that you could think about large corporations as patients, and you could perform surgery on them to make them super healthy and successful,” he said.

The story highlights a unique path to success that prioritizes value and customer trust over immediate revenue.
newTitle: From Free to Fortune: The $62 Billion Startup Journey

India doubles renewable energy addition to 15 GW, aims 500 GW by 2030: Pralhad Joshi - CNBCTV18
summary:
India Aims for 500 GW Renewable Energy by 2030, Doubling Capacity Addition to 15 GW

Publication Date: Recent

Source: CII International Energy Conference & Exhibition 2024

India has significantly increased its renewable energy capacity addition, reaching 15 GW from April to November of this fiscal year, nearly doubling from 7.54 GW in the same period last year. The government aims to achieve a total of 500 GW of non-fossil fuel-based generation capacity by 2030.

  • Renewable energy capacity in India grew to 15 GW, almost double compared to the previous year.
  • Total installed capacity of non-fossil fuel reached 214 GW with a 14% increase year-on-year.
  • The government has introduced various initiatives such as the production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme to boost solar panel manufacturing.
  • India is set to establish 50 solar parks with a total capacity of 38 GW by 2025-26.
  • By 2026-27, the PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana aims for 1 crore solar rooftop installations.
  • Support under the National Green Hydrogen Mission to promote hydrogen production and electrolyser manufacturing has been outlined.
“So yes, this transformation is not just a dream, it is happening today.” - Pralhad Joshi

This ambitious energy transition aims to cement India’s role as a global leader in renewable energy, closely linked to its vision for a sustainable and developed nation by 2047.
newTitle: India Aims for 500 GW Renewable Energy by 2030, Doubling Capacity Addition to 15 GW

Adani Group announces merger of Sanghi Industries & Penna Cement with Ambuja Cements - The Economic Times
summary:
Adani Group Merges Sanghi Industries and Penna Cement with Ambuja Cements

Date: Tuesday, Publication: ETMarkets.com

On Tuesday, Ambuja Cements, owned by Adani Group, announced the merger of Sanghi Industries and Penna Cement Industries, enabling shareholders to receive 12 shares of Ambuja for every 100 shares held in Sanghi as part of a scheme of arrangement.

  • The merger will streamline operations and enhance shareholder value.
  • Ambuja plans to increase its total cement production capacity to over 100 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) by the end of the fiscal year.
  • Last year's acquisition of Sanghi was valued at approximately Rs 5,185 crore.
  • Ambuja aims for a production capacity of 140 million tonnes by 2027-28.
  • Sanghi Industries has significant capacities and resources that complement Ambuja’s operations.
"As both the companies are under the same line of business, this amalgamation will enable us to absorb the business of Sanghi Industries completely for carrying on more effectively and beneficially," Ambuja stated.

This merger represents a strategic move by Adani Group to bolster its cement business and is expected to have positive implications on competitiveness and efficiency.
newTitle: Adani Group Merges Sanghi Industries and Penna Cement with Ambuja Cements

summary:
2025 Hyundai Creta EV Will Be Launched On January 17, Know Its Expected Price And Specifications

Date: January 17, 2025
Source: E Vehicle Info

The 2025 Hyundai Creta EV is set to launch on January 17, providing a blend of familiar design elements with modern electric features.

  • Design updates include a blanked-off grille and aerodynamic alloy wheels.
  • The interior features premium materials, including a 10.25-inch touchscreen and luxurious seating.
  • Expected battery capacity of 45 kWh with a range of over 450 km.
  • Key safety features include Level-2 ADAS, six airbags, and a 360-degree camera.
  • Pricing expected around ₹20 lakh, facing competition from other mid-range electric SUVs.
“The Creta EV is designed to win over EV buyers in India with its smart pricing and strong features.”

With its expected launch, the Hyundai Creta EV aims to cater to the growing demand for electric vehicles in the country.
newTitle: 2025 Hyundai Creta EV Launch on January 17: Expected Price and Specifications

title: Sebi notifies SIF, new asset class between PMS and mutual funds with minimum investment of Rs 10 lakh - The Economic Times
summary:
Sebi Introduces Specialized Investment Funds (SIF) with Minimum Investment of Rs 10 Lakh

Date & Source: Published on Tuesday, Source: Economic Times

Introduction: Market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has notified a new asset class called 'Specialized Investment Fund' (SIF), which accepts investments of Rs 10 lakh or more from investors. This new class is positioned between portfolio management services (PMS) and mutual funds.

  • SIF will accept investments of Rs 10 lakh or more from investors.
  • The fund manager of SIF must have the relevant NISM certification.
  • Investment strategies can be open-ended, close-ended, or interval investment strategies.
  • Fees and expenses will follow mutual fund regulations.
  • Investment restrictions include limits on debt instruments and equity shares.
An investment strategy cannot invest more than 20% of its NAV in debt instruments comprising money market instruments and non-money market instruments issued by a single issuer and are not investment grade.

Conclusion: The introduction of SIF by Sebi provides a new investment option for those with higher risk-taking capabilities, offering a middle ground between PMS and mutual funds.
newTitle: Sebi Introduces Specialized Investment Funds (SIF) with Minimum Investment of Rs 10 Lakh

Specialised investment funds: Sebi sets ₹10 lakh minimum threshold for investors | Mint - Mint
summary:
Specialised investment funds: Sebi sets ₹10 lakh minimum threshold for investors

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

In a recent update, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has established a minimum investment threshold of ₹10 lakh for investors in specialized investment funds. This move aims to enhance the investor profile in these funds.

  • Sebi mandates a new minimum investment of ₹10 lakh for specialized investment funds.
  • The decision aims to attract more serious investors and ensure better fund quality.
  • This regulation may impact the accessibility of such funds to less affluent investors.
“We believe that a higher threshold will improve the sophistication of investors in these funds,” said a Sebi official.

This regulation emphasizes the importance of focused investment strategies and aims to create a more robust investment landscape in India.
newTitle: Sebi Introduces ₹10 Lakh Minimum Threshold for Investment Funds
